meanings.definition: Covered in a thick, soft layer of hair or fur.
meanings.sent1: The fluffy bunny was so mooly, it looked like a little cloud.
meanings.sent2: The cozy blanket felt mooly against her skin.
meanings.sent3: The mooly teddy bear seemed to be the softest in the whole toy store.
meanings.sent4: The mooly cat curled up on the warm rug, resembling a fluffy ball.
meanings.sent5: The mooly alpaca had the most luxurious coat on the farm.

meanings.sent1: She saved up all her mooly to buy a new bike.
meanings.sent2: He earned a lot of mooly from his summer job.
meanings.sent3: The kids were excited to find some extra mooly in their piggy bank.
meanings.sent4: In the game, players collect mooly to upgrade their characters.
meanings.sent5: The treasure chest was filled with shiny mooly coins.
